website_summaries.verdict: Helps overcome baby's "out of sight, out of mind" impulse by teaching object permanence.
pros: Ball rolls out of base after baby drops it in, teaching that objects still exist when they disappear
Toy promotes motor control and muscle development
cons: The ball is not the highest quality, and the paint may wear off if baby mouths it
Supervise use to make sure it doesn't go in baby's mouth

customer_reviews.title: Great learning toy!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this toy when our daughter was only a month old. She loved watching me play with it while she did tummy time. Now, at 12 months, she loves playing with it! It is sturdy and has held up beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Evearitt

customer_reviews.title: I loved watching him study this toy
customer_reviews.text: It's a phase of development. I loved watching him study this toy. He got good at getting the ball long before he would release it into the box. Once he did the reward on his face was amazing. Then he practiced this skill, and still does at 18 months. We call this his school work along with other activities that hello engage different parts of his brain. Not to say that this ball never goes missing our gets thrown around the room and put in other toys. It so does. But that's part of learning too and we welcome that as well.
customer_reviews.author: homeschoolmom5Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: A little pricy.  But a nice oasis of simplicity in a desert of loud, electronic toys.
customer_reviews.text: I think this is one of the more interesting toys my daughter has. It doesn't light up or make crazy sounds. But it does have a very satisfying plop when the ball hits and comes out. Well made. Traditional toy. Simple and elegant. Pros: Stimulating Keep her attention longer than I expected. Cons: She is often just more interested in eating the ball. The toy is a little too big for a baby to do both motions from the sitting position. Sharp corners on the wood. Kind of expensive.
customer_reviews.author: TheReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great product just one word of caution.
customer_reviews.text: Very well constructed. My nine month old is now starting to get the concept and enjoys it very much. Only one criticism/caution. Our son is very big for his age and is still putting objects into his mouth. The ball is about the size of a golf ball and he can almost fit it in his mouth. Naturally, we're concerned so we watch him closely when he plays with this.
customer_reviews.author: winge1993

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken, was not fixable.
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived broken. I used wood glue to piece it back together but the slightest use results in it being broken again. It seems that the problem is the wood pieces being cut too small to properly fit together. Very disappointed to pay money and wait so long for something to be shipped here only for it to be a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Adara

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, smooth and rounded surfaces!
customer_reviews.text: Just received this, but already very happy with it. My daughter is soon to be 7mths old and I wanted to start introducing this to her. I'm very impressed with the quality and finishing of this product. I'm not worried about splintering or sharp corners, everything is smooth and rounded off. The ball is the perfect size for helping my daughter to use more pressure at her fingertips to grip, further developing that pincer grasp. The only critique I might have is that the walls of the tray be higher. It's easy for the ball to pop out of the tray.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel P.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for us
customer_reviews.text: I don't know about y'all but this thing hardly worked for my 8 months old. It looked like something made at home and the ball didnt rly disappear inside the box it just got out of the hole onto the other side which i think defeated the purpose. My baby had zero interest in it
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Worth it! Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I’m really happy I needed up buying this! My only regret was not buying it sooner! We got a gift card from a friend for my daughters 1st birthday and I decided to buy it. I have had my eye on this for a while, even though it it so simple there are many more benefits to this type of learning than a toy with buttons that makes sounds. The quality is great and feels so soft and smooth. Ideally I would have gotten this months ago to start teaching her the concept of placing the item where it needs to go. It is worth the money we paid for it for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Kyky302

customer_reviews.title: Entertains for short periods
customer_reviews.text: This didn’t keep my baby entertained for ages like I’d hoped but I might have introduced it a bit late. The one benefit I saw almost immediately was that instead of always throwing things out of containers he started to learn to put things back. Whew.
customer_reviews.author: A.S.M

customer_reviews.title: A Baby-Must have!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great learning toy as well as confidence-building! Once my grandson mastered putting the ball in the hole (at about 10 months old), he was sooooooo proud of himself! He's 14 months now and still plays with it every single day. I bought it to stay at my house, but my daughter was so thrilled with how her baby loved it, that she said it had to be at her house! This is going to be gift for new mothers. You've got to get it.
customer_reviews.author: Bev Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed, quality materials!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second object permanence box I've purchased. This box has a ramp and the ball rolls out of the box, unlike my other one. It is well constructed and made of quality materials and includes a wooden ball. As an aside, at ten months it seems like my baby has mastered this skill and is no longer interested, even if I rotate it in and out of his collection.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great Learning Toy
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. The whole wooden box looks like good quality. The plastic ball seems cheap, though. Baby hasn’t used it yet, so I can’t speak for a child’s interest. I appreciate the simple colors. Probably helpful for a child with a visual impairment, especially if you add some red tape around the hole.
customer_reviews.author: Seaybdm

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: The reason I’m giving it 4 stars it’s because the sound it makes when the ball hits inside is very loud and uncomfortable to listen to, my 9 month old was getting scared instead of wanting to play with it. Nothing a nursing pad won’t fix, I placed it inside and now when the ball drops it doesn’t make that loud sound anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Asroma

customer_reviews.title: Red color gets the kid attention
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to get this montessori toy for my son! I literally couldn't wait to get it on the mail! The fact that the ball is red is cool because it makes easier for babies eyes to follow it. He likes to play with it, mostly to chew on it. The ball is not very sturdy tho. In the very first day it was already damaged but we still enjoy playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Barboza

customer_reviews.title: Finish comes off of wooden ball in baby's mouth
customer_reviews.text: We like this toy for many of the same reasons other reviewers have stated, but are concerned about the finish on the wooden ball. It has been coming off in baby's mouth and the company has not responded to my question about what it is. I don't feel safe giving this to a baby or any child that could put it in their mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Erica M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and smooth wood
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 10 month old. He has yet to master it but loves playing with the ball. It was very smooth and well made. The ball is bigger than my sons mouth which is great so he can’t shove it in there lol. Very pleased with purchase. Lovevery is a subscription where they have a ball drop but this a better and cheaper alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Tristion stuart

customer_reviews.title: Build quality seems to be good with a minor issue in my view
customer_reviews.text: The ball was not polished very smoothly, and there are splinters coming out of it. This was a little disappointing, because you can't just take a high grit sandpaper to the ball, since other part of the ball is covered by a clear coating. The box seemed to hold up after about 3 month of use from my kid.
customer_reviews.author: Chengcheng X.

customer_reviews.title: Such an important, helpful toy!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is so basic but helpful! I showed my baby how to put the ball into the hole a couple times a day. It kept her interest and within 2 weeks, she was doing it by herself! Since then, she has started experimenting with other balls and toys "fitting into the hole" and applied that concept to other things. Very cool!
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I do really care about quality and safety of toy for my little one. This is what I was looking for ! I returned so many wooden toys because of sharpness and safety issues but this wooden box is so safe to touch with my baby’s finger and well made Thanks for the good toy !
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: No wood ball, plastic cheap ball
customer_reviews.text: Mine didn’t arrive with wood ball.. it was really cheap plastic ball. I opened the box so I miss the chance to return it..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Boring for 9 months old
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for almost 10 months old baby.He figured it out in first few minutes and then got bored.May be I bought it too late and he already had learned about object permanence.
customer_reviews.author: OP

customer_reviews.title: Beware of little wood shavings inside!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with bunch of little wood shavings inside! So frustrating it should have been checked before mailed out- this toy is for little babies!
customer_reviews.author: MargaretS

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but Loud
customer_reviews.text: Toy arrived as described. It works as described but it's very loud. The sound of the wood ball dropping onto the wood box over and over is obnoxious. Would be better if there was something to cushion inside that muffles the sound. We had to take it out of the play area because the sound was problematic.
customer_reviews.author: SuperSqueaker

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a toy my 10 month old daughter could learn to use and have fun playing with as her other toys didn’t interest her much anymore. The ball is small and is so easy for her to pick up. I’m very happy with this toy and it didn’t take that long for it to finally get here. The only “cons” which don’t matter to me are that the ball is also wooden so when dropped into the hole it makes a loud sound. But I highly recommend this toy !
customer_reviews.author: Aleigha

customer_reviews.title: Simplistic appeal
customer_reviews.text: Love this toy! My 6m old loves the ball and the little box. Hasn’t quite grasped the concept yet but I see this turning out well
customer_reviews.author: Patricia caruso

customer_reviews.title: Great Montessori toy
customer_reviews.text: We love this object permanence box. High quality construction and will last for kids and years to come. Comes with a natural wood ball. The ball size is perfect for tiny hands.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAholic

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I initially bough the 3 in 1 but returned it and purchased this one. Mine came with a perfect sized wooden ball, excellent craftsmanship, sturdy. My 11 month old is enjoying it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Nurse

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully made! Love this toy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautifully made toy! I fell in love the second I opened the box. It’s so well made and it’s bigger than expected. My toddler loves this toy. I am definitely buying more from this seller. So worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Mariam Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: The finish on the ball comes off.
customer_reviews.text: My 9 month old loves it but after two times using it the finish on the ball is coming off. He puts everything in his mouth so I had to take the ball away. I am going to look for a replacement ball or return it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is my baby’s favorite toy. It keeps him entertained for a long ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my baby’s favorite toy. It keeps him entertained for a long time. We had to buy more balls, because the one that came with this got lost under the couch.
customer_reviews.author: Raymundo Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: It's a great item and my daughter loves it already. We got the natural wood ball, which I'm really happy about. She loves peeking to see where the ball went!
customer_reviews.author: Alex F

customer_reviews.title: 10 month old loves
customer_reviews.text: Great toy for my 10 month old. I was worried I would get a plastic ball, but the one I received was wood. Overall very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Expat

customer_reviews.title: Teach object permanence and cause and effect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect game to teach object permanence and cause and effect. The only negative is because it’s made out of real wood my child hit herself sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: simon s

customer_reviews.title: You get what you order.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you order. Unfortunately it didn’t occupy my kid as long as others. Was expecting my kid to love it but maybe I have to wait a while. He’s 9 months old.
customer_reviews.author: Lul Nurani

customer_reviews.title: Good quality toys
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my then 10 month old. She loves this you. It's her favorite. Very sturdy and well made. I ordered other toys from this maker and they're all great quality
customer_reviews.author: Princess Kaguya

customer_reviews.title: High quality product
customer_reviews.text: Amaizing product! We love it! One of my son 's favorite toys. High quality product, all edges are smooth and the wood is smooth and nice to touch. Definitely buy it. You will not retreat.
customer_reviews.author: MirYo

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Really nice quality for the money. This is superior quality but on a budget price. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Just wish wooden educational toys were less expensive, but you are paying for something that will last forever so I get it... my pocket just gets sad about it lol
customer_reviews.author: Luisa Pou

customer_reviews.title: love this product
customer_reviews.text: Whats more to say than I love this product and kids love this product. Its sturdy, and well made
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Henrich

customer_reviews.title: What I wanted
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly what I was hoping for. It came with a sturdy wooden ball. The wood is nice quality. Perfect for Montessori babies.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: 👍🏻
customer_reviews.text: 👍🏻 Very good material my sun has it for 3 months already and trough it every where and nothing had happened to it.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as it should!
customer_reviews.text: The object permanence box is a traditional Montessori material that is designed to foster the concept of object permanence, things still exist even when you can’t see them. It also indirectly helps them develop focus and concentration and gives them practice developing fine motor skills through the whole-hand grasp. The box was designed exactly as the Montessori!
customer_reviews.author: Vee2104

customer_reviews.title: Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I’m very happy with this toy. Very well Made,quality is excellent. My 10months old is figuring out how to Play with it!
customer_reviews.author: Dom Kve

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made & exactly what we wanted! My baby loves this toy! The wood is smooth: not rough at all.
customer_reviews.author: Vee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My 9 month old loved this performance box! ♡ it also works with other balls, the grimsby fit nicely along with other practice golf tee's

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, but doesn’t attract baby very much
customer_reviews.text: It is a good product, my baby played with it for a while but lost interest very quickly, he loves the Hape ball dropping xylophone though, a little bit disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Aileen

customer_reviews.title: Already broke :(
customer_reviews.text: So I love the idea and price of this product but the quality is horrible. Mine is already broken from my one year old setting it down to hard.

customer_reviews.title: Love wooden toys
customer_reviews.text: No sharp edges. Great price. Not a choking hazard. My daughter really likes it.

customer_reviews.title: So much fun
customer_reviews.text: My almost 9 months old baby loved it. Even my 3 yrs old played with this toy. Definitely glad I purchased this item.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great quality! We’ve had this a head and it’s in perfect condition. Baby still loves messing with sometimes.

customer_reviews.title: Item is as described
customer_reviews.text: Great Montessori toy! It is very well made and not cheap. A great price too

customer_reviews.title: Wooden ball
customer_reviews.text: Our 10 month old understood this right away. Unfortunately her favorite thing to do is to throw the heavy wooden ball around lol. Very nice wooden toy.

customer_reviews.title: Feels like I have a Montessori playroom
customer_reviews.text: This toy is well made and feels very high-end. Creates hours of fun for my 9-month-old

customer_reviews.title: High quality Toy
customer_reviews.text: All around excellant toy. Well made and will be enjoyed for a long time.

customer_reviews.title: Nice feel and mechanics
customer_reviews.text: The balls rolls out beautiful once dropped in. Baby loves it!!

customer_reviews.title: Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Great little box! My 6 month old enjoys watching us put the ball in the hole and seeing it come out. I know in several months he will enjoy doing it as well. Great quality product. Would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: David Kurtz

customer_reviews.title: Fun and exciting
customer_reviews.text: My daughter felt so accomplished the first time she was able to put the ball in the hole. It kept her entertained for a few minutes a day. I’d say the only downside is that I wish one more ball would’ve came with it.
customer_reviews.author: crystal padilla

customer_reviews.title: Broken on arrival, falling apart in less than a month
customer_reviews.text: One of the side pieces was not connected upon receipt. I glued the piece but now, less than a month later, the other side piece has fallen off as well.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Pishko

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: A really nice object permanence box. Large and sturdy. The ball does roll back nicely. It's good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Montessori material for my 10m old baby. He really loved it. I really would recommend this item to any parent that what to invest in their children’s learning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: don't waste your time or money
customer_reviews.text: This was awful. Boring and all wood means if there are rough areas the baby could get hurt. Definitely do not recommend this.

customer_reviews.title: Kid loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed and has held up to the infants play.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Purchase
customer_reviews.text: The box is made from nice, clean, and sturdy wood. It’s just beautiful and the perfect size for little hands. It’s my son’s favorite toy since he first played with it. It’s an absolute joy to watch him interact with it in various ways and watch his little gears grinding. Well worth the cost!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Wish it came with a wooden ball. Other than that my baby enjoys it.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and my daughter is enjoying figuring it out.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Klosowski

customer_reviews.title: A purchase you won't regret
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what it is about this toy but my 14 month old loves it. I bought extra wiggle golf balls (is that what they're called?) because the one that came with it gets lost all the time. I would definitely recommend this. She likes it much more than the plastic flashy toys and so do I.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Lee

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Such a simple yet entertaining toy! I bought this for my almost 8 month old to use and my 4yr old will even sit down for 30min at a time and play with it! Who would've thought, Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy
customer_reviews.text: Great toy and it keeps her interest. She loves the ball especially.
customer_reviews.author: Travis A Youngs

customer_reviews.title: Quality product, very simple.
customer_reviews.text: It is well crafted but my son got bored with it super quickly. Maybe would be better for a slightly younger child.
customer_reviews.author: sammysam

customer_reviews.title: Very cool, but overpriced
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this toy and plays with it over and over again. I do think it is a bit overpriced considering what it is, however. I also wish the ball was a bit bigger; it is almost a borderline choking hazard, so we always watch him with it.
customer_reviews.author: E. H.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Ball was missing. The top of the ball drop was damaged/ scratched. Truly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: sincerelyy_ana

customer_reviews.title: Heirloom quality
customer_reviews.text: It’s so great to see a real wooden toy. I got it for my baby, and I could see her kids playing with it someday!
customer_reviews.author: K R K

customer_reviews.title: Great interactive toy
customer_reviews.text: Great item, wish the packaging had been better, the ball was loose in the box and could have easily been damaged upon arrival. Overall satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks well built and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our daughter who is currently 7.5 months old. Really can't be used well until they are mobile. She sits up and tries to play with it but it's a little to big for her to get close enough. Will bring it out again once she can crawl. Looks well built and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Perry

customer_reviews.title: Good product, wish the edge and corners can be more blunt
customer_reviews.text: The build quality is okay. There are bevels around the sharp corners and edges, but I wish they are more blunt
customer_reviews.author: J.C. Lee's

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This has been hands down my girl's favorite toy. Keeps going back to it over n over again.

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, Great Toy
customer_reviews.text: Great toy! Very good Quality, I love it. It's Montessori. But expensive..

customer_reviews.title: Good idea
customer_reviews.text: It get my kid attention and start trying to put the ball in the hole after couple of time.

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: This came to my door about a month after ordering. My daughter was 9 months old at the time and has really enjoyed this toy. It came with a red wooden ball instead of the white plastic one in the photo. It is made decently enough.
customer_reviews.author: Kiyonai

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully made
customer_reviews.text: My son has not mastered this yet. But it is beautifully made! We have had this over a month now. And my son does throw the box and ball around. Has no sign of damage! I highly recommend this

customer_reviews.title: Well-made, great toy!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made toy- wish I had gotten it earlier for my son. He enjoyed it at 16 months but could have easily played with it from 6 months on!

customer_reviews.title: Interesting Toy for 8 months old
customer_reviews.text: This one is interesting for a 8 months old and keeps him entertained. But, any toy with a "Montessori" concept is a bit over priced.
customer_reviews.author: Kurihara N.

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: As a Montessori teacher of some 10+ years, the quality and price is impossible to beat. Forget Etsy and Nienhaus and make this purchase! Hope they come out with more items!

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t come with a ball so it is worthless..
customer_reviews.text: It looks great, but didn’t come with a ball, so pretty much pointless?

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality! My baby is 9 months and still doesn’t quite understand it but I personally really like it.

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: My son is obsessed with this honestly - I got it for him at 11 months. I’ll hide it for a week or two then re introduce it. He’s now 14 months and still loves it.

customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son’s first birthday and he loved it! Even my toddler was playing with it. Simple design, but effective.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but kind of silly that it came ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, but kind of silly that it came with a plastic wiffle ball. I took a wooden ball from the Melissa and Doug pounding toy and use that instead.
customer_reviews.author: kristinak

product_meta.title: Elite Montessori Object Permanence Box with Tray and Ball
feature_bullets: 🌱A child has to drop the little ball into the hole in the box. The ball will roll out of the box and into the attached tray thus allowing the child to experience object permanence by seeing that the ball did not just disappear.
🌱It practices precise hand movements while sending information to the brain as well as develops hand, wrist and finger control - also known as "refined hand movements".
🌱With repeated use of this material, the child learns how it feels to succeed when he has achieved a goal on his own.
